CHANGE.ITEM: Added TYPEs to DIVs in order to validate. Proofed title page(s). Check TEXT for LANG attribute. Checked for GROUP tags. Checked s. Reviewed structure. Checked division-marking material at heads and feet of divisions (HEADS, CLOSER, OPENER, ARGUMENT, EPIGRAPH, SIGNED, BYLINE, etc.). Checked for signatures. Checked placement and completeness of PBs. Checked for damage GAPs, #s, @s, --s, and UNCLEARs. Checked spacing of foreign GAPs. Checked for LBs. Checked for Qs, startqs, endqs, oes, q;s. Check LETTER tags. Check Ls. Check TABLEs. Check LISTs. Check NOTEs. Checked for FIGUREs and decorated initials. Checked for missing-page GAPs and duplicates. Checked proofsheets and made corrections found there. Corrected 32 $-groups. Revalidated.

DIV1.HEAD: By His Excellency Coll. Benjamin Fletcher, Captain General and Governour in Chief of His Majesties Province of New-York, &c. A POCLAMATION
DIV1.P: WHeras I have received certain intelligence of a late horrid and detestable conspiracy, against the sacred life of Our Soveraign Lord King William, and of an intended invasion to be made the Kingdom of England, upon the atal intended blow: all which by the great and Almighty God is wonderfully discovered and prevented to the gre joy and Majestyes loving and loyal Subjects I have therefore by advice of his Majestyes Povince thought fit to appoint, thursday the 4th of Iune next ensuing be observed and kept of thanks giving; to render praises to Alghty God for his gracious and wonderfull , kindness, in granting us this happy deliverance, and to supplicate for the continuation of mercy towards us, in preserving his Mestyes Sacred Person, so frequently exposed the safety and welfare of his people, and to give success and Victory to his Majestyes arms at Sea and Land. And all Ministers and Preachers of the word of God, and all other Persons what∣soever within this Province and dependancyes, hereby required strictly to observe and keep the same Churches or publick meeting houses; they will answer the contrary at their peril.

CLOSER.DATELINE: Given his Majestys Fort in New York, the 2 of May, in the Eighth Year of the Reign of our Soveragn Lord WILLIAM the Third King of England, Scotland, France and Ireland, Defender of the Faith, &c. Anno{que} Domini 1696.

DIV1.P: Printed and Sold by William Bradford, Printer to His Majesty at the Bible in the City of New-York 1696.
